ai-mn22:13.5_0: “Suppose there was a person traveling along the road.
ai-mn22:13.6_0: He’d see a large deluge, whose near shore is dubious and perilous, while the far shore is a sanctuary free of peril.
ai-mn22:13.7_0: But there was no ferryboat or bridge for crossing over.
ai-mn22:13.9_0: ‘This is the near shore, and avoiding the far shore.
ai-mn22:13.10_0: But there is no ferryboat or bridge for crossing over.
ai-mn22:13.11_0: ‘Why don’t I gather grass, sticks, branches, and leaves and make a raft? Riding on the raft, and paddling with my hands and feet, I can safely reach the far shore.’
ai-mn22:13.12_0: And so they’d do exactly that.
ai-mn22:13.13_0: And when they’d crossed over to the far shore, they’d think,

ai-mn22:13.25_0: But that person would do with the raft.

ai-mn22:27.2_0: Any kind of feeling at all ...

ai-mn22:28.1_0: Seeing this, a learned noble disciple grows disillusioned with form, feeling, perception, choices, and consciousness.
ai-mn22:29.1_0: Being disillusioned, desire fades away. When desire fades away they’re freed. When they’re freed, they know they’re freed.
ai-mn22:29.2_0: He understands: ‘Rebirth is ended, the spiritual journey has been completed, what had to be done has been done, there is no return to any state of existence.’
ai-mn22:30.1_0: This is called a mendicant who has lifted up the cross-bar, filled in the trench, and pulled up the pillar; who is unbarred, a noble one with banner and burden put down, detached.
ai-mn22:31.1_0: And how has a mendicant lifted the cross-bar?
ai-mn22:31.2_0: It’s when a mendicant has given up ignorance and given rise to knowledge, cut it off at the root, made it like a palm stump, obliterated it, so it’s unable to arise in the future.
ai-mn22:31.3_0: That’s how a mendicant has lifted the cross-bar.
ai-mn22:32.1_0: And how has a mendicant filled in the trench?
ai-mn22:32.2_0: It’s when a mendicant has given up transmigrating through births in future lives, cut it off at the root, made it like a palm stump, obliterated it, so it’s unable to arise in the future.
ai-mn22:32.3_0: That’s how a mendicant has filled in the trench.
ai-mn22:33.1_0: And how has a mendicant pulled up the pillar?
ai-mn22:33.2_0: It’s when a mendicant has given up craving so it is cut it off at the root, made it like a palm stump, obliterated it, so it’s unable to arise in the future.
ai-mn22:33.3_0: That’s how a mendicant has pulled up the pillar.
ai-mn22:34.1_0: And how is a mendicant unbarred?
ai-mn22:34.2_0: It’s when a mendicant has given up the five lower fetters, cut them off at the root, made them like a palm stump, obliterated them, so they’re unable to arise in the future.
ai-mn22:34.3_0: That’s how a mendicant is unbarred.
ai-mn22:35.1_0: And how is a mendicant a noble one with banner and burden put down, detached?
ai-mn22:35.2_0: It’s when a mendicant has given up the conceit ‘I am’, cut it off at the root, made it like a palm stump, obliterated it, so it’s unable to arise in the future.
ai-mn22:35.3_0: That’s how a mendicant is a noble one with banner and burden put down, detached.
ai-mn22:36.1_0: When a mendicant’s mind is freed like this, the gods together with Indra, Brahmā, and Pajāpati, search as they may, will not find
ai-mn22:36.2_0: anything that such a Realized One’s consciousness depends on.
ai-mn22:36.4_0: Because even in the present life the Realized One is undiscoverable, I say.

ai-mn22:37.2_0: ‘The ascetic Gotama is an exterminator. He advocates the annihilation, eradication, and obliteration of an existing being.’
ai-mn22:37.3_0: I have been falsely misrepresented as being what I am not, and saying what I do not say.
ai-mn22:37.4_0: ‘The ascetic Gotama is an exterminator. He advocates the annihilation, eradication, and obliteration of an existing being.’
ai-mn22:37.5_0: In the past, as today, what I describe is suffering and the cessation of suffering.
ai-mn22:37.6_0: This being so, if others abuse, attack, harass, and trouble the Realized One, he doesn’t get resentful, bitter, and emotionally exasperated.
ai-mn22:38.1_0: Just this others don’t honor, respect, esteem, and venerate the Realized One.
ai-mn22:38.3_0: ‘They do such things for what has already been completely understood.’

ai-mn22:39.4_0: ‘They do such things for what has already been completely understood.’

ai-mn22:42.1_0: So the teaching has been well explained by me, made clear, opened, illuminated, and stripped of patchwork.
ai-mn22:42.2_0: In this teaching there are mendicants who are perfected, who have ended the defilements, completed the spiritual journey, done what had to be done, laid down the burden, achieved their own goal, utterly ended the fetters of rebirth, and are rightly freed through enlightenment. For them, there is no cycle of rebirths to be found. ...
ai-mn22:43.1_0: So the teaching has been well explained by me, made clear, opened, illuminated, and stripped of patchwork.
ai-mn22:43.2_0: In this teaching there are mendicants who have given up the five lower fetters. All of them are reborn spontaneously. They are extinguished there, and are not liable to return from that world. ...
ai-mn22:44.1_0: So the teaching has been well explained by me, made clear, opened, illuminated, and stripped of patchwork.
ai-mn22:44.2_0: In this teaching there are mendicants who, having given up three fetters, and weakened greed, hate, and delusion, are once-returners. All of them come back to this world once only, then make an end of suffering. ...
ai-mn22:45.1_0: So the teaching has been well explained by me, made clear, opened, illuminated, and stripped of patchwork.
ai-mn22:45.2_0: In this teaching there are mendicants who have given up three fetters. All of them are stream-enterers, not liable to be reborn in the underworld, bound for awakening.
ai-mn22:46.1_0: So the teaching has been well explained by me, made clear, opened, illuminated, and stripped of patchwork.
ai-mn22:46.2_0: In this teaching there are mendicants who are followers of principles, or followers by faith. All of them are bound for awakening.
ai-mn22:47.1_0: So the teaching has been well explained by me, made clear, opened, illuminated, and stripped of patchwork.
ai-mn22:47.2_0: In this teaching there are those who have a degree of faith and love for me. All of them are bound for heaven.”
ai-mn22:47.3_0: That is what the Buddha said.
